hardwareAbstraction
Class UltrasonicMotor

java.lang.Object
  hardwareAbstraction.UltrasonicMotor

public class UltrasonicMotor
extends java.lang.Object

Controls the Ultrasonic motor. It keeps track of whether or not the ultrasonic sensors are in the forward position or not. Uses the motor define in the Settings file, Which is a NXTRemoteMotor.

It is assumed the side ultrasonic sensors will be facing forward when the robot starts. Furthermore, this method will keep track of its position and will not rotate twice in the same direction (ie two identical calls will not have double rotation).

Field Summary

          Whether the Ultrasonic sensor face forward or not.

Method Summary
static void setDefaultPosition()
          The default position is set to be with the two side ultrasonic sensors pointing away from the center of the robot.
static void setForwardPosition()
          The forward position is set to be with the two side ultrasonic sensors pointing directly ahead, in line with the centre ultrasonic sensor.

Field Detail

isForward

public static boolean isForward
Whether the Ultrasonic sensor face forward or not. default is true. Robot should start facing forward.

Constructor Detail

UltrasonicMotor

public UltrasonicMotor()
Method Detail

setDefaultPosition

public static void setDefaultPosition()
The default position is set to be with the two side ultrasonic sensors pointing away from the center of the robot. Therefore, it will be at an angle when viewed from the front of the robot. They rotate 90 degrees

setForwardPosition

public static void setForwardPosition()
The forward position is set to be with the two side ultrasonic sensors pointing directly ahead, in line with the centre ultrasonic sensor. Therefore, it will be at an angle when viewed from the front of the robot.

sleep

private static void sleep(int time)
Sleeps the thread for a specified time

Parameters:
time - time to sleep the thread
